Israeli army approaches Gaza City: 'We are not waiting'
subhead: With Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu yet to make a decision on a temporary ceasefire proposal, maneuvers are underway around the Gaza Strip's largest city, which the army calls a Hamas 'stronghold.' More than 120,000 reservists are expected to be deployed on the ground in the coming weeks.

title: Zelensky says could meet Putin only after allies agree on Ukraine security guarantees
23 economists: 'We call for an immediate halt to any policy that intensifies widespread starvation in Gaza'
subhead: While Gazans are the primary victims of human rights violations in the Palestinian enclave, the economic repercussions could also be catastrophic for Israel, warns a group of European and American economics professors, including 10 Nobel Prize winners, in an open letter.

title: Macron vows to 'defend my honor' amid viral smear campaign against his wife
subhead: The French president addressed the false claim that his wife, Brigitte Macron, was born a man in an interview with 'Paris Match.' He said he was prepared to pursue legal action 'all the way' to ensure the main spreaders of the lie are held accountable.

title: Merz sparks outcry over possible German military involvement to defend Ukraine
subhead: Even if the deployment of German troops remains hypothetical, the mere mention of it was enough to polarize a country deeply rooted in pacifist culture. For the Social Democrats, coalition partners of the conservative chancellor, any involvement of the Bundeswehr would be inconceivable without American participation.

title: Why scientists are divided over whether there is a 'sixth mass extinction'
subhead: American researchers have reignited the debate over the concept by publishing an article that questions the idea of a new mass extinction event that is comparable in scale to the one that wiped out the dinosaurs.

title: French streamer's on-air death: Does the Kick platform bear responsibility?

title: In the Donbas, a Ukrainian high schooler's rebellion against Russification
subhead: At her Russian-controlled high school near Luhansk, a pro-Ukrainian teenager who resisted propaganda was the target of relentless disciplinary action since January. Fearing that she could be placed in foster care or even adopted, her mother decided to flee the occupied territory.

title: The rise and fall of a gang of crypto-ransom kidnappers
subhead: The criminal group behind a string of violent kidnappings in France that recently made headlines started this activity as early as 2023 and was planning further 'attacks.' Its mastermind was arrested on June 3 in Morocco.
byline: By Antoine Albertini and Soren Seelow

title: What is Kick, the platform on which a French streamer died live?
subhead: Raphaël Grave, known online as Jean Pormanove, died Monday during a livestream. The tragedy has shed light on a little-known streaming site and its extremely permissive moderation policies.
byline: By Damien Leloup and Olivier Clairouin
